forumNotes.author: doestergaard
forumNotes.content:
Hi everyone! This will be my first post here, so I hope you will make me feel welcome. ![:rolleyes:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/rolleyes.gif) I have tried almost any USB-MultiBoot application out there, but all with the same result - NOT WORKING AS EXPECTED! When it comes to install operating systems from USB, I came across, that Windows - especially XP, had problems with booting the Setup - causing a BSOD "Blue Screen of Death" after loading setup-files. I believe many have the same issue, if not lucky you ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) This what i got in mind: Making a full capable MultiBoot USB with all the windows os installations. (ISO's or folder) Possibility for a user to make his own menu.lts, with a step-by-step guide - making it more user-friendly A full menu with all your OS/Tools/etc. Possibility to add more OS/Tools/etc. when you need it.
Hope somebody will work with me on this. I know a little bit about coding, but I'm not a master ![:thumbup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbup.gif) Thanks in advance! Greetings, Daniel

forumNotes.author: doestergaard
forumNotes.content: EDIT: forgot to mention, that this of cause also can be possible installing other os, like linux, ubuntu. Short: All OS'es should be capable.

[USB CD Emulator](http://renosite.com "External link") - Mayby this is something you might want to check out. At least the code is open source and will save you having to start from scratch like I did when I started 2 years ago.

There are two projects, 1 - slow but cheep and 2 - fast but a little more work/money to get going.

forumNotes.author: statica
forumNotes.content:
Hi I have made a multiboot USB with different Windows installations and other programs/tools which I use for my work as im an IT-Technician and it is nice to have 1 usb stick with all the tools you normally carry around on several dvds. Here is a list of what is on my multiboot USB and all these are tested and working: Windows 7 installation XP Pro Installation Win7PE LiveXP Ultimate Boot CD 5.03 Memtest86+ 4.10 Easeus Disk Copy 2.3 F-Secure Rescue CD Kaspersky Rescue CD Barts Disktool Windows Password Remover Partition Wizard 5
All this fits on a **EDIT:** 4GB and not 2GB USB stick and is tested but as there are some older computers which cant handle USB boot to well I have had 1-2 times where a program wouldnt work.
So if you need help with your project then I will help with my trial and error experience ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png) **Edited by statica, 29 April 2011 - 11:58 PM.**
